claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A table presenting vaccine effectiveness (VE, % with 95% CI) for different influenza vaccine types (RIV4 and SD-IIV4 for ages 18–64; RIV4, RIV4 + HD-IIV4 + Adj-IV, and SD-IIV4 for ≥65) across various subgroups (overall, by sex, risk condition) and seasons (2018–19, 2019–20). The table reports observed VE percentages for recombinant (RIV4) versus standard egg-based (SD-IIV4) vaccines but contains no information on mutations arising during production or their impact on effectiveness and therefore does not support the claim. Note: Analysis limited to visible table data; no mechanistic or production‐related details are provided in this image.
